info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 7:09AM EDT until April 7 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio...
Portage River At Woodville affecting Sandusky and Wood Counties.
For the Portage River...including Woodville...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Portage River at Woodville.
* WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Water over State Route 105 in Sandusky County. Water near homes on Water, Bierley, and Bridge Streets in Pemberville. The river floods Trail Marker Park up to Erie Street in Woodville.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 11.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall Saturday morning. It will rise to 10.3 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/cle.
The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 515 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON
